intro: Rosa micrantha var. plicata, commonly known as the wrinkled rose, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its compound leaves with a distinctive, wrinkled or plicated appearance. The plant produces fragrant, pink to red flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a border plant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
